page.title: 03Morchard Bishop's population
page.content: When the main turnpike road to Barnstaple passed through the village there were approximately 2000 people, now there are only half that number. Now there is a good cross-section of population.Some have lived here all their lives,others returned after being evacuated here during the war. Pensioners have come here to retire, some because of harassment in London or just to enjoy the countryside.The oldest resident is a lady of 96.Young families contribute to the flourishing "playgroup".Teachers and others commute to neighbouring towns,but some find the cost of travelling too high and move away.Owing to the varying nature of their jobs,it is not now quite such a close knit community. Family farms use their own labour though some daughters work away.
